entry.title: 小孩子对你说过的最犀利的话是什么？_Quora文选
entry.content:
语言选择

  • English

1. English

What’s the most savage thing a kid said to you?

Anshul Agarwal · CSE from RV College of Engineering (RVCE) (Graduated 2019)

​ 323.6K views · 38.6k Upvotes

A usual day when I’m teasing my 13 year old sister in front of everyone, but this time destiny had other plans.

Scene: She was playing with my laptop in the hall, where my entire family was sitting.

Me: Why are you playing with someone else’s laptop? Play with your own laptop…. Ohh sorry, you don’t have one.

(I hit lightly on her head)

(After 2 minutes she was playing with my mobile phone)


Me: Why are you playing with my phone? Play with your own…. Ohh sorry, you don’t have one

(I hit lightly on her head again)


Sister: Why are you touching other’s brain; touch your own…Ohh sorry, you don’t have one

The entire family burst into laughter.

Sister rocked, I was shocked.

2. 中英译文

What’s the most savage thing a kid said to you?
小孩子对你说过的最犀利的话是什么？_Quora文选

A usual day when I’m teasing my 13 year old sister in front of everyone, but this time destiny had other plans.
很平常的一天，我在大家面前逗弄我13岁的妹妹，但这次命运似乎另有安排。

Scene: She was playing with my laptop in the hall, where my entire family was sitting.
场景是这样的：她在客厅里玩儿我的笔记本电脑，全家人都在。

Me: Why are you playing with someone else’s laptop? Play with your own laptop…. Ohh sorry, you don’t have one.
我说：你为什么玩儿别人的笔记本电脑呢？玩你自己的笔记本电脑去吧，哦，对不起，你没有（电脑）。

(I hit lightly on her head)
（我轻轻拍了一下她的头）

(After 2 minutes she was playing with my mobile phone)
（两分钟后，她又开始玩儿我的手机）


Me: Why are you playing with my phone? Play with your own…. Ohh sorry, you don’t have one.
我说：你为什么玩儿我的手机呢？玩你自己的去吧，哦，对不起，你没有（手机）。

(I hit lightly on her head again)
（我又轻轻地拍了一下她的头）


Sister: Why are you touching other’s brain; touch your own…Ohh sorry, you don’t have one.
妹妹反击道：你为什么总拍别人的脑子？拍你自己的去吧，哦，对不起，你没有（脑子）。

The entire family burst into laughter.
听到这儿，全家都笑了起来。

Sister rocked, I was shocked.
妹妹的反击太厉害了，我被震惊到了。

entry.title: 人生多艰，我们该怎么办？_Quora文选
entry.content:
语言选择

欢迎关注“Quora文选”公众号

  • English
  • 中英译文

1. English

What do people do when life gives them ‘lemons’?

Anuradha Tiwari ·

​ 800.7K views · 43.2k Upvotes

I had just turned on my laptop when I received a mail from my HR informing about the meeting. He asked me to come with the laptop and nobody was carbon copyed except my boss then General Manager. I was working as a design engineer that time. I had a big argument with my boss the day before so I thought it might be related to that, some warning etc.

As soon as I reached his office, he told me that my boss was not happy with my performance and that I had been terminated immediately and was asked to give my laptop the same time.

My response? blank

I gave my laptop to him and left the office taking my stuff. I told everybody about my termination who met me on the way and asked me why I was leaving with the stuff. The good thing was I took that in the good spirit without any embarrassment as I was already not sharing good terms with my boss.

I went to Starbucks straight from the office. I took out my notepad and wrote down all the things I always wanted to do but couldn’t due to my 12 hours job. The first thing I wrote was a solo trip. The list was like this:

  • solo trip
  • complete a book- which I have been writing since a year
  • start an NGO- which I always wanted to
  • read one novel in a month

I did everything mentioned above. I left the next day for the solo trip of four days and the trip made me realize many things which I was missing in my life. I did complete my book and published it. I did start my own NGO and I did read one book in a month and still doing it.

When life gives you lemons, make lemonade!! :)

▌“Quora文选”词汇:

1️⃣ 𝗰𝗮𝗿𝗯𝗼𝗻 𝗰𝗼𝗽𝘆 /ˈkɑːbən ˈkɒpi, ˈkɑrbən ˈkɑpi/
n. 副本，复写本（就是常说的cc，抄送）
She kept a carbon copy of all her correspondence.（她保留了所有信件的副本。）

2️⃣ 𝘀𝗵𝗮𝗿𝗲 𝗴𝗼𝗼𝗱 𝘁𝗲𝗿𝗺𝘀 𝘄𝗶𝘁𝗵 /ʃeə ɡʊd tɜːmz wɪð, ʃɛr ɡʊd tɜrmz wɪð/
phr. 关系良好
She shares good terms with her colleagues.（她和同事关系很好。）

3️⃣ 𝗡𝗚𝗢 /ˌɛn dʒiː ˈoʊ, ˌɛn dʒiː ˈoʊ/
n. 非政府组织
The NGO provided aid to the disaster-stricken area.（该非政府组织向受灾地区提供了援助。）

2. 中英译文

What do people do when life gives them ‘lemons’?
人生多艰，我们该怎么办？_Quora文选

I had just turned on my laptop when I received a mail from my HR informing about the meeting. He asked me to come with the laptop and nobody was copied except my boss then General Manager. I was working as a design engineer that time. I had a big argument with my boss the day before so I thought it might be related to that, some warning etc.

我刚打开笔记本电脑，就收到了HR的邮件，通知我去参加会议。他让我带上笔记本电脑去参加，除了我的老板和总经理，邮件里没有抄送其他人。那时我是一名设计工程师，前一天我和老板大吵了一架，所以我猜可能是因为这个，要给我个警告之类的。

As soon as I reached his office, he told me that my boss was not happy with my performance and that I had been terminated immediately and was asked to give my laptop the same time.

刚到办公室，他就告诉我老板对我的表现不满意，我被解雇了，立刻、马上！还要求我当场交出笔记本电脑。

My response? blank

我的反应？当时很茫然。

I gave my laptop to him and left the office taking my stuff. I told everybody about my termination who met me on the way and asked me why I was leaving with the stuff. The good thing was I took that in the good spirit without any embarrassment as I was already not sharing good terms with my boss.

我把笔记本电脑交给他，收拾好东西离开了办公室。路上遇到的人问我为什么拿着东西离开，我告诉他们我被解雇了。好在我心态很好，没有觉得尴尬，因为我和老板的关系本来就不好。

I went to Starbucks straight from the office. I took out my notepad and wrote down all the things I always wanted to do but couldn’t due to my 12 hours job. The first thing I wrote was a solo trip. The list was like this:

我直接从办公室去了星巴克。我拿出记事本，写下了那些因为每天12小时工作而一直无法实现的愿望，写下的第一件事是一次独自旅行。我的清单是这样的：

  • solo trip
    独自旅行

  • complete a book- which I have been writing since a year
    完成一本我已经写了一年的书

  • start an NGO- which I always wanted to
    创办一个我一直梦想的非政府组织

  • read one novel in a month
    每月读一本小说

I did everything mentioned above. I left the next day for the solo trip of four days and the trip made me realize many things which I was missing in my life. I did complete my book and published it. I did start my own NGO and I did read one book in a month and still doing it.

我完成了清单上的每一项，第二天我就出发了，进行了为期四天的独自旅行，这次旅行让我意识到生活中错过了很多东西。我完成了我的书并出版了，我创办了自己的非政府组织，每月读一本书，并且一直坚持着。

When life gives you lemons, make lemonade!! :)

当生活给你柠檬时，就把它们做成柠檬水吧！（英语谚语，意思是当生活给你带来困难时，要积极应对，把困境转化为机会。）

人生以痛吻，我却我报之以歌。

entry.title: 有必要等那个不确定爱你的人吗？_Quora文选
entry.content:
语言选择

欢迎关注“Quora文选”公众号

  • English
  • 中英译文

1. English

Is it okay to wait for a person, who is not sure if he or she loves you?

Demilade Fayemiwo · Former Science Faculty at South Africa

​ 566.1K views · 14.8k Upvotes

I’ll give you a very quick answer here. When a person says they are not sure if they love you, they are actually telling you they don’t love you. Hesitation is a response. Silence is a response. Being unsure of something or someone is a response.

I know this because I was madly in love with someone for years and he always hesitated. He was never really sure, couldn’t tell if I was the right fit even though when we were together, the stars aligned (for me anyway). He eventually met someone and invested a lot in that person within a short space of time. It became clear to me that the reason he hesitated was because he did not believe at any point in time that I was the one.

Don’t wait for anyone who is unsure about you. Love is not unsure. It does not hesitate. If a person says they might grow to love you, bear it in mind that they will grow to leave you when ‘better’ comes along.

And of course, it hurts to read this answer. But I say let your heart bleed early enough. It won’t kill you. You will meet someone. Scratch that. You will meet lots of people who will jump onboard without the least bit of hesitation because they just can’t imagine their lives without you, imperfect or flawed as you may be.

Leave this unsure person.

▌“Quora文选”词汇:

1️⃣ 𝘀𝘁𝗮𝗿𝘀 𝗮𝗹𝗶𝗴𝗻 /stɑːz əˈlaɪn, stɑrz əˈlaɪn/
phr. 星星排列（比喻时机成熟，万事俱备）
When the stars align, everything falls into place perfectly.（当天时地利人和时，一切都会完美地就位。）

2️⃣ 𝘀𝗰𝗿𝗮𝘁𝗰𝗵 𝘁𝗵𝗮𝘁 /skrætʃ ðæt, skrætʃ ðæt/
phr. 算了，取消前言
Scratch that, I think we should go with the original plan.（算了，我觉得我们还是按照原计划进行吧。）

2. 中英译文

Is it okay to wait for a person, who is not sure if he or she loves you?
有必要等那个不确定爱你的人吗？_Quora文选

I’ll give you a very quick answer here.
我会很快地给你一个答案。

When a person says they are not sure if they love you, they are actually telling you they don’t love you.
当一个人说他不确定是否爱你时，其实他是在告诉你他不爱你。

Hesitation is a response. Silence is a response. Being unsure of something or someone is a response.
犹豫是一种回应，沉默是一种回应，不确定对某事或某人的感情也是一种回应。

I know this because I was madly in love with someone for years and he always hesitated.
我知道这一点，因为我曾疯狂地爱了一个人多年，而他总是犹豫不决。

He was never really sure, couldn’t tell if I was the right fit even though when we were together, the stars aligned (for me anyway).
他从未真正确定过，不知道我是否合适，尽管在我看来，我们在一起时，已经万事俱备了。

He eventually met someone and invested a lot in that person within a short space of time.
他最终遇到了某人，并在短时间内对那个人投入了很多精力。

It became clear to me that the reason he hesitated was because he did not believe at any point in time that I was the one.
那时候我终于明白了，他犹豫的原因是他从未认为我就是那个对的人。

Don’t wait for anyone who is unsure about you.
不要等待任何对你不确定的人。

Love is not unsure. It does not hesitate.
真正的爱是肯定的，是不犹豫的。

If a person says they might grow to love you, bear it in mind that they will grow to leave you when ‘better’ comes along.
如果一个人说他们可能会爱上你，请记住，当“更好的人”出现时，他们也会渐渐离开你。

And of course, it hurts to read this answer. But I say let your heart bleed early enough. It won’t kill you.
当然，看到这个答案会很痛。但是我想说的是，让你的心早点儿认清事实，这没什么大不了。

You will meet someone. Scratch that. You will meet lots of people who will jump onboard without the least bit of hesitation because they just can’t imagine their lives without you, imperfect or flawed as you may be.
你终将会遇到某个人。更正一下，你会遇到很多人，他们毫不犹豫地走进你的生活，因为他们无法想象没有你的生活，即使你并不完美。

Leave this unsure person.
离开这个不确定爱不爱你的人。

1. English

What’s something everyone knows but no one wants to admit?

Abdullah Shiryar · Had my share of experience in life.

​ 138.7K views · 8.2k Upvotes

See if this sounds familiar:

It is one day before the weekend, you are very excited and thinking:

“This weekend will be so productive! I can not wait to start writing that book I have been planning forever now, I might even go running early in the morning, I could probably fix the fence too, oh and I should definitely visit grandparents, I can not remember the last time I saw them, maybe I should pick some groceries from the supermarket and cook dinner for the family…”

But deep down you know very well that your entire schedule for the weekend consists of:

  • Laying down in bed in your sweatpants all day.
  • Eating junk food.
  • Wasting your time on the Internet.
  • And feeling regretful the next Sunday night.

entry.title: 有哪些小事儿能看穿一个人的人品？_Quora文选
entry.content:
语言选择

欢迎关注“Quora文选”公众号

  • English
  • 中英译文

1. English

What small thing can tell you a lot about a person?

Bharti Amarnani · Smile, laugh, live, life is too short to hold grudges!

​ 62.3K views · 2.8k Upvotes

  1. If someone respectfully greets his servant and drivers, you know that the person is down to earth with high quality etiquettes.
  2. If someone doesn’t go against his parents, you know that he respects their opinion and more than that respects his parents.
  3. If someone finds money lying on the road and gives a treat to his workers out of it, you know that the person is not greedy.
  4. If someone thinks more about ‘WE’ rather than a simple ‘I’, you know that he has a soulful heart with a taste of humanity.
  5. If someone likes to work behind the scenes, you know that he is not working for credit, he is genuinely working to get the things done.
  6. If he comes all the way back just to drop you home, you know that he cares for you!
  7. If someone waits for his colleagues to join before starting with the meal, you know that he values relations more than his own self-interest.
  8. If he gives his seat to the old man in a public transport even after a tiring day, you know that he is always ready to help the needy.
  9. If he celebrates his birthday with orphans or at old age home, you know that he has a heart filled with love.
  10. If someone thinks about your happiness more than his own, you know that he values you more than anyone else!

▌“Quora文选”词汇:

1️⃣ 𝗲𝘁𝗶𝗾𝘂𝗲𝘁𝘁𝗲𝘀 /ˈetɪket, ˈetɪˌkɛt/
n. 礼仪，礼节
Good etiquettes are essential for smooth social interactions.（良好的礼仪对于顺利的社交互动至关重要。）

2️⃣ 𝗲𝘁𝗶𝗾𝘂𝗲𝘁𝘁𝗲 /ˈetɪket, ˈetɪˌkɛt/
n. 礼仪，礼节
He studied business etiquette before his first formal meeting.（在第一次正式会议之前，他学习了商务礼仪。）

2. 中英译文

What small thing can tell you a lot about a person?
有哪些小事儿能看穿一个人的人品？_Quora文选

  • If someone respectfully greets his servant and drivers, you know that the person is down to earth with high quality etiquettes.
    如果有人尊敬地问候他的仆人和司机，你就知道这个人谦逊且有高尚的礼仪。

  • If someone doesn’t go against his parents, you know that he respects their opinion and more than that respects his parents.
    如果有人不违背父母的意愿，你就知道他尊重他们的意见，更尊重他的父母。

  • If someone finds money lying on the road and gives a treat to his workers out of it, you know that the person is not greedy.
    如果有人在路上捡到钱并用它请他的工人吃饭，你就知道这个人不贪心。

  • If someone thinks more about ‘WE’ rather than a simple ‘I’, you know that he has a soulful heart with a taste of humanity.
    如果有人更多地考虑“我们”而不是简单的“我”，你就知道他有一颗充满人性的心灵。

  • If someone likes to work behind the scenes, you know that he is not working for credit, he is genuinely working to get the things done.
    如果有人喜欢在幕后工作，你就知道他不是为了功劳而工作，而是真心实意地想把事情做好。

  • If he comes all the way back just to drop you home, you know that he cares for you!
    如果他特意绕路送你回家，你就知道他关心你！

  • If someone waits for his colleagues to join before starting with the meal, you know that he values relations more than his own self-interest.
    如果有人在吃饭前等待同事一起加入，你就知道他重视关系胜过个人利益。

  • If he gives his seat to the old man in a public transport even after a tiring day, you know that he is always ready to help the needy.
    如果他在一天劳累之后仍在公共交通工具上给老人让座，你就知道他总是准备好帮助有需要的人。

  • If he celebrates his birthday with orphans or at old age home, you know that he has a heart filled with love.
    如果他在孤儿院或养老院庆祝生日，你就知道他有一颗充满爱的心。

  • If someone thinks about your happiness more than his own, you know that he values you more than anyone else!
    如果有人比起自己的幸福更在意你的幸福，你就知道他比任何人都更看重你！

What is the best short story on friendship?

Yogesh Krishnani ( યોગેશ ક્રિષ્નાણી ) · Lives in Ahmedabad, Gujarat, India (1991–present)

​ 209.8K views · 12.6k Upvotes

This happened in the winter of 2014.

My sister was getting married on 15th December and on the same day one of our friend from college was also getting married. And both the functions were in different cities and about 400 km away.

I deliberately didn’t give invitation card to any of my college friends as I wanted everyone to go and attend our classmate’s marriage.

The day came. My sister got married. Now in the middle of our function at night what I see two of my best college friends were there.

How did they manage to come ? As They were in different city on the same day.

They left as soon as marriage of my friend got over, took the train. They asked one of my office friend about address of our marriage hall. And in the winter night when the temperature was below 10 degrees. They came riding on bike just to attend marriage of my sister without any invitation.

That feeling was inexpressible.

Lesson learnt -

Sometimes you don’t need an invitation card!

2. 中英译文

关于友谊的最佳短篇故事是什么？_Quora文选

This happened in the winter of 2014.
这是2014年冬天发生的事。

My sister was getting married on 15th December and on the same day one of our friends from college was also getting married. And both the functions were in different cities and about 400 km away.
我的妹妹在12月15日那天结婚，而我们的一个大学同学也在同一天结婚。而且这两个婚礼在不同的城市，相隔大约400公里。

I deliberately didn’t give an invitation card to any of my college friends as I wanted everyone to go and attend our classmate’s marriage.
我特意没有给任何一个大学朋友发请柬，因为我希望大家都能去参加我们同学的婚礼。

The day came. My sister got married. Now in the middle of our function at night what I saw were two of my best college friends.
那天如期而至，我妹妹结婚了。那天晚上，在我们的婚宴中途，我居然看到了我的两个最好的大学朋友。

How did they manage to come? As they were in a different city on the same day.
他们是怎么赶来的呢？因为他们那天原本在另一个城市。

They left as soon as the marriage of my friend got over, took the train. They asked one of my office friends about the address of the marriage hall. And in the winter night when the temperature was below 10 degrees, they came riding on a bike just to attend the marriage of my sister without any invitation.
他们在我朋友的婚礼一结束就赶紧搭乘火车，他们向我的一位同事打听了婚宴的地址。而在气温低于10度的冬夜里，他们骑着摩托车赶来，只为了参加我妹妹的婚礼，尽管没有受到邀请。

That feeling was inexpressible.
那种感觉是无法用言语表达的。

Lesson learnt-
得到的教训就是：

Sometimes you don’t need an invitation card!
有时候，你根本不需要请柬！

不过，你妹妹结个婚，为嘛要给同学请柬呢？

What are the best ways to make your life easier?

​ 66.9K views · 2.1k Upvotes

  1. If you can’t make it to something, let the person know ASAP.
  2. Date in private, love in private & rebuild yourself in private.
  3. If a narrow minded or ignorant person says “1+1 = 5”. Don’t correct them, let them enjoy & leave. Life is too short.
  4. Change your personality according to situation. Play dumb, badass or wise according to situation.
  5. If someone is shouting at you in anger, put your hands in pocket, smile & then walk away. Don’t wrestle with a pig, unless situation demands.
  6. Learn to say “I don’t know” or “I was wrong”.
  7. Cleanse your social media from people that bring up negative emotions.
  8. Use Night mode in mobile to avoid having your screen throw off your circadian rhythms.
  9. Engage in mindfulness and meditation.
  10. Set the bar high for yourself & focus on that.
  11. Consume good content before sleeping & after awakening (Not motivational).
  12. Outside is outside leave it there no one pays rent in your mind. What others do or say is their reflection. Don’t think about others. Your Ex is drinking wine with someone else now. Move on.
  13. Avoid foods that drain your energy.

What is the best lesson you learnt from life?

Deepa Thakur · Former Student

​ 608.9K views · 13.8k Upvotes

There’s a maid in our hostel. Everyday I greet her with a smile. Even this morning, I said, “ Good morning Aunty, how are you?”

She looked at me but did not reply anything. I got angry. But as I was about to leave the mess, I asked her, “Aunty… Is everything alright? You look sad today.” She sat in a chair and I sat beside her. There the story started.

She said, “My husband is admitted in hospital for the last three days and I am unable to take leave from my work as my payment will be deducted and I am in need of money right now. In 2010, he fought against paralysis and it took 1.5 lakhs rupees for his treatment. Now again he has piles. He underwent an operation for this last month but the blood is coming out from the stool again. The doctors are unable to find out the main reason for this and they can’t do anything until the bleeding stops.” She shared all her problems with me for almost half an hour and I was listening to it silently.

Hearing all these my eyes filled with tears.

Deep inside, I was feeling guilty as I could not do anything for her. I promised myself that one day I will make myself so capable that I could help at least one person in need. I only said everything will be alright aunty. Keep faith in God!”

Then, she smiled as she spoke her heart out to me. She was relaxed now and said, “ Thank you for listening beta. I am feeling good now.”

So, this incident made me realize that sometimes all you can do for someone is lending your ears attentively. It does help a lot.

Everyone you meet is fighting a battle. You never know what pain they are going through.

Be kind always!

我们招待所里有一位女佣，每天我都会微笑着问候她。今天早上我也对她说：“早上好，大娘，您今天好吗？”

她看了我一眼，但没有回话，我很生气。不过在我要离开餐厅时，我问她：“大娘，您还好吗？今天您看起来很忧郁。”她坐在一把椅子上，我坐在她旁边，故事就从这里开始了：

She said, “ My husband is admitted in hospital for the last three days and I am unable to take leave from my work as my payment will be deducted and I am in need of money right now. In 2010, he fought against paralysis and it took 1.5 lakhs rupees for his treatment. Now again he has piles. He underwent an operation for this last month but the blood is coming out from the stool again. The doctors are unable to find out the main reason for this and they can’t do anything until the bleeding stops.” She shared all her problems with me for almost half an hour and I was listening to it silently.
她说：“我丈夫已经住院三天了，但我无法请假，否则工资会被扣，而我现在正需要钱。2010年，他曾与瘫痪抗争，花了十五万卢比治疗。现在他又得了痔疮。上个月做了手术，但现在又有便血。医生查不出主要原因，直到出血停止前他们什么也做不了。”她与我倾诉了将近半个小时，我默默地听着。

Deep inside, I was feeling guilty as I could not do anything for her. I promised myself that one day I will make myself so capable that I could help at least one person in need. I only said everything will be alright aunty. Keep faith in God!”
在内心深处，我感到内疚，因为我无能为力。我对自己承诺，总有一天我要让自己变得足够强大，至少能帮助一个有需要的人。我只能说：“一切都会好的，大娘妈，要相信上帝！”

Then, she smiled as she spoke her heart out to me. She was relaxed now and said, “ Thank you for listening beta. I am feeling good now.”
然后，她微笑着向我倾诉了心声。她现在轻松了许多，说道：“谢谢你听我说，孩子，我现在感觉好多了。”

So, this incident made me realize that sometimes all you can do for someone is lending your ears attentively. It does help a lot.

每一个你遇见的人都在与自己的生活拼搏，你永远不知道他们正在经历怎样的痛苦。

Be kind always!

What is your best everyday tip?

Sean Kernan ·

​ 175.7K views · 6.9k Upvotes

Get some damn sleep!

Seriously. Why do you keep torturing yourself? I go to sleep 9 hours before I need to wake up. That gives me time to fall asleep.

Your body is designed to like routine. So if it is Friday or Saturday, that doesn’t mean stay up till 4 am just because you can. It’ll take till Wednesday to feel normal.

When I made a commitment to get sleep every night, my life improved drastically; my mood, my academic and athletic performance all went through the roof.

Do you really want to slump through life fatigued? Is that the life you want? Everything sucks when you are tired.

The trick to falling asleep: you have to pretend to be asleep in order to fall asleep. (don’t think, turn your mind off) White noise helps too.

Stop taking naps. And turn these electronics off! They are like crack!

If you are reading this right now and it’s past your “bedtime”, do yourself a favor and turn your phone off and get some sleep, kid!

My husband of 28 years came home early from work one day, sat down at the table and told me he was just fired for having an affair with a 25 year old girl at work.

In that moment, with that one sentence, everything inside me shut down and I was in shock, numb.

Until then, I had truly believed he was my best friend and I was a lucky woman.

We ended up losing our dream home, went bankrupt, sold everything of value and cashed out our retirement to survive (I have a good job but his salary was 4x’s mine).

We now live in a small apartment like we did when we first got married.


Those are just “things” though.

What hurts most is how it affected the future of our (then) teen children. We couldn’t help them through college or keep them on health, dentist, and car insurance. All for a few quick fucks.

He is extremely remorseful and worked long and hard to win my heart back. Our marriage counselor considers us a huge success story. I have forgiven him and all seems happy now. But secretly, whatever it was that went numb inside me on May 6th at that breakfast table, has never come back to me. I’m afraid it never will.

I hope if you are married, or even happily employed, that this post will make you think twice should you need to.

entry.title: 保持一颗好奇心有多重要
entry.content:
保持一颗好奇心有多重要

新时代的文盲

在这个AI时代，有大量的人没在用AI，吴恩达教授说，这恐怕就是新时代的文盲

我好奇地问他们，期望了解他们是如何思考的

后来我才发现，人们宁愿持续重复做一项事情，每次做这项任务，成本可能是3小时，而他会觉得自己学习一个东西要花10个小时甚至更多。

就这样，选择一直重复劳作，一直难以投入新事物的学习

也正因如此，他要学的东西开始积压，越来越多

当他意识到自己要被淘汰的时候，想去学习了，发现原来要搞明白很多事情，要投入比之前更多的精力成本

这时候可能就只能放弃，学不动，也没活儿干，然后只能跑腿送外卖

好奇心驱动

相反，那些持续学习的人，并不是因为他们有多么强的学习能力，而是好奇心驱动

好奇有没有更好的办法达到更好的效果，好奇新鲜事物和未来的东西，这些往往带来了较多的动力持续进步

每次要学的内容增量其实就会逐渐变小，以更快的理解力获取内容

我举个例子，

如果你是一个经常学习的人，有一个系统教程给你，你不会从头开始看的，你会意识到自己需要看哪里，然后挑选去看

但如果什么都没接触过的人，他就会选择从头开始，甚至学几下可能就放弃了，因为前面都是概念，没有任何正反馈，无法实操也无法看到结果

这就是持续学习，和积攒知识负债后再启动学习之间的差异

但好奇心这个东西，往往与生俱来，人们最好能找到自己喜欢的那个事情，从那个切口去接触AI

  • 比如你喜欢写作，你就从写作中接触AI，怎么让AI有能力写的比你还要好
  • 比如你喜欢游戏，你就从游戏中接触AI，是不是可以构建一个关于泰拉瑞亚的Agents问答助手，从此不需要在搜索wiki
  • 比如你喜欢运动，你有没有想过如何用AI来辅助你提升运动质量

这些切入点，往往比什么「AI焦虑症」更能让你主动的开始

What is the best advice your father ever gave you?

​ 648K views · 30.5k Upvotes

One day I had a fight with my Mom and shouted at her and did not have my lunch. I went out with my friends, and had food. Later, when I came back, I hesitated to face my Mom so I went to my room and started watching TV.

Then my Dad came to me and asked me why didn’t I have lunch.

I told him that I had food with my friends and didn’t want to have food cooked by Mom as I fought with her.

He listened to what I said and then said to me , ‘You know, I sometimes don’t like what your Mom says or what she does but have you seen me shouting at her or fighting with her ?’

I said, ‘No.’

He said, ‘If you or me or your sister fight with your Mom then we can go out with our friends or colleagues and have food, chill out and come back whenever we want. But have you ever thought of your Mom after you shout at her? She will sit there and think for the whole day why you shouted at her and she will not have food for the whole day. So think before you shout at her or fight with her, you have a whole world outside waiting to hangout with you but for her you, your sister and I are her world and when any one of us shout at her, then her whole world gets wrecked. For you it’s just a matter of few seconds of anger so if you can suppress it for sometime, you can make her world a happy one. ‘

I honestly try not to shout or fight with my Mom anytime after that or even if I fight with her I make sure I apologise as quickly as possible.

What’s something that sucks about being a man?

Gary Chapman · Developing games software since the dawn of time

​ 1.1M views · 18.2k Upvotes

I was walking in the park and a little girl, about 4 years old, was crying her eyes out at the path next to the playground. No adults around, just her, sobbing her little heart out.

All I wanted to do is go up, lower myself to her level, give her a little hug and ask where her mommy and daddy were… but I couldn’t. Modern society says that a man on his own near a park, talking to children is a threat.

So, I had to keep my distance until I’d got the attention of a female walking her dog.

Society is broken when a man feels he can’t even comfort a crying child.

I understand it. But it truly sucks.
